p: Individual social capital was assessed using the Personal Social Capital Scale 16 (PSCI-16) questionnaire; anxiety was assessed using the Self-Rating Anxiety Scale (SAS) questionnaire; stress was assessed using the Stanford Acute Stress Reaction (SASR) questionnaire; and sleep was assessed using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire. Pearsonâ€™s correlation analysis showed that the PSCI-16 score for social capital was positively associated with the SAS score for anxiety (r=0.619, P<0.01), the SASR score for stress (r=0.543, P<0.01), and the PSQI score for sleep quality (r=0.479, P<0.01).
